definition: the intersection of two streets, to turn a corner
details:
noun
- the intersection of two streets
= example: the intersection of two streets
= synonyms: street corner, turning point
- (architecture) solid exterior angle of a building
= example: (architecture) solid exterior angle of a building
= synonyms: quoin
- an interior angle formed by two meeting walls
= example: an interior angle formed by two meeting walls
= synonyms: nook
- the point where two lines meet or intersect
= example: the point where two lines meet or intersect
- a place off to the side of an area
= example: a place off to the side of an area
- a remote area
= example: a remote area
- the point where three areas or surfaces meet or intersect
= example: the point where three areas or surfaces meet or intersect
- a projecting part where two sides or edges meet
= example: a projecting part where two sides or edges meet
- a small concavity
= example: a small concavity
= synonyms: recession
- a predicament from which a skillful or graceful escape is impossible
= example: a predicament from which a skillful or graceful escape is impossible
= synonyms: box
- a temporary monopoly on a kind of commercial trade
= example: a temporary monopoly on a kind of commercial trade
verb
- to turn a corner
= example: to turn a corner
- to force a person or an animal into a position from which he cannot escape
= example: to force a person or an animal into a position from which he cannot escape
= synonyms: tree
- to gain control over
= example: to gain control over
